LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: 5G mobile networks spread COVID-19.
COVID-19 is spreading in many countries that do not have 5G mobile networks.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can self-treat for COVID-19 by taking chloroquine phosphate, an additive used to clean fish tanks.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine prevent coronavirus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Although chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine have been mentioned as possible treatments for COVID-19, fish tank cleaning products that contain chloroquine phosphate are not intended for human use.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: While chloroquine phosphate can be used to treat malaria, it is a dangerous, lethal poison if not used correctly with a physician.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Neither hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine have been proven to definitively work for COVID-19. Preliminary data suggest a small benefit but this has to be validated.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Ingesting disinfectants can help treat a coronavirus infection.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Ingesting bleach can help treat a coronavirus infection.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Ingesting rubbing alcohols can help treat a coronavirus infection.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Drinking methanol or ethanol DOES NOT prevent or cure COVID-19 and can be extremely dangerous

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by injecting bleach into your body.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by injecting disinfectants into your body.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by injecting rubbing alcohol into your body.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by bathing in bleach.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by bathing in disinfectants.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by bathing in rubbing alcohol.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by rubbing bleach on yourself

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by rubbing disinfectants on yourself

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by rubbing rubbing alcohols on yourself

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by swallowing bleach

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by swallowing disinfectants

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can protect yourself from COVID-19 by swallowing rubbing alcohols

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The coronavirus remains in the throat for 4 days, causing sore throat and coughing before it reaches the lungs. Drinking a lot of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the virus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: While it is true that coronavirus can cause a sore throat and gargling with warm water may make it feel better, it has no direct effect on the virus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Drinking alcohol does not protect you against COVID-19 and can be dangerous

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Drinking green tea can prevent you from getting the coronavirus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: There is no drink hot or cold that will protect you from COVID-19 or cure the illness

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can avoid the virus by drinking warm water every 15 minutes

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: There’s also a claim that if people drink cold water, their lungs will become fibrotic. I want to stress that there's no evidence at all to support these claims

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: I can get the coronavirus from food, food packaging, or food containers.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The FDA (Food and Drug Administration) says “there is no evidence of food or food packaging being associated with transmission of COVID-19,” noting that the theoretical risk of infection is tiny; the virus primarily spreads person-to-person via close contact.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You should scrub down your groceries and mail.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can boost your immune system and lower your risk of getting COVID-19 by eating sweet potatoes and taking certain vitamins and supplements, or taking colloidal silver.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: There is no evidence that you can boost your immune system by eating sweet potatoes, taking specific vitamins or supplements, or ingesting silver

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: A daily vitamin C supplement, essential oils, colloidal silver soap, sesame oil, garlic, and/or fish tank cleaner will all protect you from the virus.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Taking vitamin C, vitamin D, zinc, green tea or echinacea to boost their immune systems can help prevent getting the coronavirus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Vinegar can kill the coronavirus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Adding pepper to your soup or other meals DOES NOT prevent or cure COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The US Food and Drug Administration says you don’t need to wash fresh produce with soap and water, but you should rinse it with plain water.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The public water supply is contaminated with the COVID-19 virus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: There are currently no drugs licensed for the treatment or prevention of COVID-19

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: There is no current medicine recommended to treat COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: At the moment there is no proven cure for COVID-19, but most people will recover on their own without needing professional medical care

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: A vaccine to cure COVID-19 is available

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: There are no vaccines to prevent COVID-19

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Getting the flu shot will prevent you getting the coronavirus.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Vaccines against pneumonia can protect you against the new coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: I can take antibiotics, such as amoxicillin, to treat COVID-19.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Antibiotics are effective in preventing and treating the new coronavirus
Ibuprofen makes COVID-19 worse.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: I can get COVID-19 from my mail or other packages that I receive.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Only Chinese people have the coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You should avoid or be afraid of all Chinese people. Actually, why bother distinguishing, just avoid all people of East Asian descent in general.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Certain races and/or ethnicities cannot get COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Diseases can make anyone sick regardless of their race or ethnicity. Fear and anxiety about COVID-19 can cause people to avoid or reject others even though they are not at risk for spreading the virus.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Some people cannot catch coronavirus, including young children, African-Americans or people with HIV or sickle cell disease.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Chinese doctors confirmed that African people are "genetically resistant" to new coronavirus.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Children cannot get coronavirus.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Children are immune to the coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Young people don’t get sick from a coronavirus infection.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Coronavirus affects all people equally.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: For young people, it’s better to get coronavirus now to develop an immunity to it.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: We have seen [in a study out of China] that children are being infected in the same distribution as other age groups—they’re just not symptomatic. Unless you were really carefully doing contact tracing, you would miss those kids and might have the impression that kids just aren’t getting infected. It does appear … that kids are getting infected—they just have minimal symptoms. So the good news continues to be that so far no reports have come out saying that kids are getting severe illness in high numbers, but it does appear that kids are getting infected in the same way that other age groups are getting infected.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19 is more dangerous for elderly people or people suffering from other infections or ailments. Children so far seem to be less affected by the disease.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Older people and people with other health conditions, such as asthma, heart diseases and diabetes, are more at risk

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: If you were sick with COVID-19, you need a clearance from your doctor to return to work.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Mosquitoes and ticks transmit the coronavirus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The new coronavirus CANNOT be transmitted through mosquito bites.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19 IS NOT transmitted through houseflies

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: At this point, there is no genetic evidence of anything other than a naturally occurring virus. It is true that there is a major laboratory in Wuhan that studies coronaviruses and has a large collection of coronaviruses. But from the analyses that have been done … there isn’t any evidence that this virus has been engineered or is different from something that has been found in nature.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The virus originated in a laboratory in China

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: For most people, the immediate risk of becoming seriously ill from the virus that causes COVID-19 is thought to be low. Older adults and people of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be at higher risk for more serious complications from COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Around one in six people will become severely ill and develop difficulty breathing, in which case they will need hospital care. In serious cases COVID-19 can cause pneumonia.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The majority of people do not have a a high-risk of serious illness complications from COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, or use an alcoholbased hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol to help not contracting COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: There are simple ways that can help yourself to stay healthy and others like Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing; going to the bathroom; and before eating or preparing food.When in public, wear a cloth face covering that covers your mouth and nose. Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands. Stay home when you are sick. Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: You can also get coronavirus by touching infected surfaces, then touching your mouth, eyes or nose.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: You can help stop COVID-19 by knowing the signs and symptoms: Fever Cough Shortness of breath Seek medical advice if you Develop symptoms. Have been in close contact with a person known to have COVID-19 or live in or have recently traveled from an area with ongoing spread of COVID-19. Call ahead before you go to a doctor’s office or emergency room. Tell them about your recent travel and your symptoms.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Most people who get COVID­-19 will have a mild form of the illness and recover without needing professional medical care

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The latest estimates are that 80 percent of the people who get infected with the new coronavirus will experience a mild or moderate form of disease. Roughly 15 percent will develop a severe form of the disease requiring hospitalization. Some 5 percent will become critically ill.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The virus can be in someone’s body for up to 14 days before they get symptoms, and some people will have such a mild case of COVID-19 that they might not notice that anything is wrong

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: This virus has a long incubation period – up to 14 days – giving a wide window of opportunity for people to infect others before they even know they’re infected.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Coronavirus can be spread unknowingly for many more days than the flu. People with coronavirus might not get symptoms for 14 days, and some get no symptoms at all. But during that time, they’re still contagious and can infect others unknowingly. But the incubation period for the flu is much shorter, and most people get symptoms within two days of infection.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Someone who has completed quarantine or has been released from isolation does not pose a risk of infection to other people

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The coronavirus was deliberately created or released

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Ordering or buying products shipped from overseas will make a person sick

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The prolonged use of medical masks* when properly worn, DOES NOT cause CO2 intoxication nor oxygen deficiency

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Most people who get COVID-19 recover from it

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Thermal scanners are effective in detecting people who have a fever (i.e. have a higher than normal body temperature). They cannot detect people who are infected with COVID-19

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19 is spread through respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs, sneezes or speaks.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: You can become infected from respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or talks.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The coronavirus primarily spreads between people through respiratory droplets, like through coughs, sneezes, spittle.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Exposing yourself to the sun or to temperatures higher than 25C degrees DOES NOT prevent the coronavirus disease (COVID-19)

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Cold weather and snow CANNOT kill the new coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The return of hot, humid weather will end the spread of the virus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19 virus can be transmitted in areas with hot and humid climates

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Taking a hot bath does not prevent the new coronavirus disease

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Hand dryers are an effective way in killing the new coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Vacationing in a warm climate helps avoid infection.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Being able to hold your breath for 10 seconds or more without coughing or feeling discomfort DOES NOT mean you are free from the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) or any other lung disease.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The "breath test" — trying to hold your breath for at least 10 seconds — can determine whether you have coronavirus

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: How long you can hold your breath is not related to whether or not you have COVID-19

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The most common symptoms of COVID-19 are dry cough, tiredness and fever. Some people may develop more severe forms of the disease, such as pneumonia. The best way to confirm if you have  the virus producing COVID-19 disease is with a laboratory test.  You cannot confirm it with this breathing exercise, which can even be dangerous.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Regularly rinsing your nose with saline can help prevent infection with the new coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Saline nasal rinses fight coronavirus infection.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: COVID-19 is no worse than the seasonal flu

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: COVID-19 is the same as the flu.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The virus is just a mutated form of the common cold

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: COVID-19 is like getting a cold.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Only people with visible symptoms of COVID-19 are capable of spreading the virus

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The virus can spread from person to person, including by people who appear to have no symptoms. This makes it much harder to get a good picture of the way it’s spreading

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Coronavirus (COVID-19) is an illness caused by a virus that can spread from person to person.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The virus is easily spread through saliva when kissing.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Wearing shoes spreads the COVID-19 virus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Although both COVID-19 and seasonal influenza are both respiratory illnesses, they have many differences.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Only older adults should worry about COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19 can affect people of any age.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Pregnant women need to take extra precautions to protect themselves against COVID-19.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2, has spread worldwide since late 2019. Classified as a global pandemic, COVID-19 has caused millions of illnesses and hundreds of thousands of deaths worldwide.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: If I am outdoors, I do not need to practice social distancing.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: While it is less likely that you will catch COVID-19 in open areas, it is still important to stay at least 6 feet away from others. Some people with COVID-19 have no symptoms and can spread the disease through respiratory droplets.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Social distancing only works if everyone stays within their immediate household circles. Exposing yourself to even one additional person increases transmission risk.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Social distancing isn’t necessary if you’ve already been infected.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: It’s dangerous to go outside during the pandemic.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Face coverings cause hypoxia

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Use of cloth face coverings is recommended in public because they can prevent people who have COVID-19 — possibly without any symptoms — from passing it along to others. The coverings do not block out viruses.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: If I and everyone around me are wearing cloth face coverings, there’s no need to practice social distancing.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Cloth face coverings are NOT a replacement for social distancing. Whenever you are outside your home or around anyone outside your immediate household circle, you should stay 6 feet away from others.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Wearing a facemask will prevent me from getting the coronavirus.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: While you should wear a facemask in public, it doesn’t guarantee full protection against COVID-19.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Wearing a cloth face covering/mask will keep me safe if I am around anyone who has COVID-19.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: If you don’t have fever, cough and shortness of breath, you don’t have COVID-19

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Fever, dry cough and difficulty breathing are hallmarks of coronavirus.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Cats and dogs spread coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can catch COVID-19 from your pet.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Everyone with COVID-19 dies

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The coronavirus is a death sentence.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Coronavirus is the deadliest virus known to humans

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Wearing gloves when you go out decreases the chance of infection.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Daily life is drastically different around the world.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The virus that causes COVID-19 is a new coronavirus that has spread throughout the world.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19 symptoms can range from mild (or no symptoms) to severe illness.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: You can become infected by coming into close contact (about 6 feet or two arm lengths) with a person who has COVID-19. COVID-19 is primarily spread from person to person.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Social distancing works by reducing the number of people you meet in a day, which slows the spread of the virus. This will help to stop the health system from becoming overwhelmed with large numbers of patients needing care at the same time.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Face masks always protect against coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: SARS-CoV-2 is just a mutated form of the common cold

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Home remedies can cure and protect against COVID-19

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The outbreak began because people ate bat soup

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The coronavirus came from bat soup

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You need anti-bacterial soap to kill the coronavirus germs

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: I can disinfect my mask by putting it in the microwave instead of washing it with soap and water.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: Hand sanitizer is as effective as soap and water in killing coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Stores will run out of food, water and toilet paper

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: I’m healthy and symptom-free, so it’s safe to resume normal activities and to invite people to my home.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: If you recovered from COVID-19, you can’t donate plasma or join a study to help develop a vaccine.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: If you test negative for COVID-19, it means you likely weren’t infected at the time of your nasal swab specimen collection. However, a negative result won’t show if you’re early in the infection process

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: I shouldn’t risk donating blood during the COVID-19 response.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: COVID-19 is increasing the risk of a stroke in infected patients.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: This coronavirus is highly contagious. Without mitigation efforts like stay-at-home orders, each person with coronavirus infects, on average, another two to three other people. That makes it twice as contagious as the flu.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You can get the coronavirus if you eat at Chinese restaurants in the US

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: The coronavirus can travel by wind and you should not be outside.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: You have to be with someone for 10 minutes to catch the virus

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: If you have coronavirus, "you'll know"

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: COVID-19, otherwise known as coronavirus disease 2019, is a new illness that affects your lungs and airways.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The virus was discovered in Wuhan, China in December 2019 and has since spread around the world. It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization on 11 March 2020.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Bill Gates invented COVID-19.

MESSAGE: The government and scientists are hiding information about the coronavirus

LABEL: MYTH

MESSAGE: COVID-19 will break up NATO

MESSAGE: The novel coronavirus is a bioweapon.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: FEMA has coordinated shipments of more than 4.3 million respirators, 1 million facial/surgical masks, 1.5 million gloves and 14,000 face shields to VA facilities across the country.

LABEL: MYTH
MESSAGE: Undocumented immigrants are at risk for deportation if they call a doctor or go to a hospital for coronavirus testing or treatment.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: If 95% of Americans wore face masks in public, it would save more than 33,000 lives by October 1, according to projections from the University of Washington’s Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: According to data from the CDC, young adults (between ages 18 and 44) had the highest number of infections. As of late May, this age group represented 39% of all coronavirus cases.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: According to data from the CDC, senior adults over the age of 75 had the highest number of deaths. As of late May, this age group represented 58.4% of all coronavirus related deaths.

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: The new coronavirus can live for up to 72 hours on stainless steel and plastic, up to 24 hours after landing on cardboard, and up to four hours after landing on copper, according to a study funded by the US National Institutes of Health.

MESSAGE: Around the world, 1.6 billion children have been affected by school closures, according to UNESCO.

LABEL: FACTS

LABEL: MYTH

LABEL: FACTS

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: As of May 1, only about 7 million tests were given in the United States, which indicates about 2% of the population has been tested.

LABEL: FACTS

LABEL: FACTS
MESSAGE: More than 9.4 million people on multiple continents have contracted the new coronavirus.

MESSAGE: COVID-19 has claimed more than 483,200 lives.

MESSAGE: You can be screened for COVID-19 via telehealth services.
